page.title: 16 Factory at Weaverthorpe
page.content: Now known as{Boythorpe}Ltd.,this factory was built at Weaverthorpe in the sixties by a local businessman and farmer. It was hoped that it would give{employment}to local men. Some- times there are several local men working there but now, of the 30 shop- floor workers and 12 office staff, only 2 men and 1 cleaner live in this village. The{Boythorpe cropstores,}and to a lesser extent the{slurry containers, are to be seen all over England and many have been exported to Germany, Iceland, Sweden, France, Ireland and the U.S.A. In 1980 the firm then known as "Gasgoigne". was given the{Queen's {Award for Industry}and an excellent buffet meal was provided in a marquee for all the staff, after the Marquess of Normanby made the presentation.
